forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow likely. Cloudy. High near 29, with temperatures falling to around 21 in the afternoon. North wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New snow accumulation of around one inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow likely before midnight. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 8. Wind chill values as low as -4. Northwest wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New snow accumulation of less than one inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning unfolds in Boston, a soft blanket of clouds envelops the city, shrouding it in an atmospheric embrace that hints at the snow soon to grace the streets. The temperatures stand resolutely near twenty-nine, yet a brisk northward breeze whispers through alleyways and parks, promising a chill that will gradually lower to a sharp eight degrees tonight. Visibility might be less than ideal, but the snow commands a subtle beauty, lending the world a quiet tranquility. While snowflakes may begin their descent this morning, the chance of accumulation is a whisper away from an inch, and the winds, gusting up to twenty-one mph, will likely slice through even the most layered clothing, demanding a thoughtful approach to dressing.

As the afternoon creeps closer, the call for warmth resonates dearly; so bundle yourself snugly in your most resilient coat, add a potent scarf to ward off the cold, and perhaps lace up those weather-ready boots. This is not a day for fleeting outdoor excursions; instead, consider a leisurely stroll through the crimson and evergreen-touched parks, or nestle in a cozy café with a steaming cup of cocoa, cradling the warmth while snow swirls outside. Embrace the stillness that often accompanies such wintry weather, and let the soft hush of the city on a snow-laden day beckon your spirit to savor the calm before twilight sets in, bringing with it the promise of a deeper cold and a snowy night ahead.
